post.body: audrey tautou (or maybe the other way around- I want play her for a day in amelie)
I agree
I'm still madly in love with my iPhone (the honeymoon phase has lasted a year and a half and counting...)
many miles away but in the same warm, strange misty-ness.
feeling like a grown up and a little girl at the same time. maybe cuz I went to the studio today dressed like a 1930's cutout paper doll...
the end of a lovely day spent doing almost nothing (so rare & enjoyable) with the love of my life. a pretty good life I have...
dog whisperer is one of the few tv shows I like- interesting to think about the energy we put out into the world and how it affects others..
how many clementines is too many to eat? they're so tiny and fun to peel apart...
deciding whether I should do some work or curl up with one of my new books...
been given so many gifts- the question is how to use them (and when)...
these things wouldn't be half as enjoyable if we didn't work so hard for them...
cozied up with my Obama rolling stones issue- good, heartfelt reading.
highlight of my day so far: going to the grocery store in my pj's & snowboots to buy eggs to make omelettes for my friends (singing outloud)
amazing how when you believe something, it becomes true
spending the day doing nothing or everything- one day to do whatever I feel like. love boxing day!
had a lovely dream last night but in the time it took to open twitter, it disappeared w/out a trace. funny how dreams are such whispy things
loving my family and friends especially during these moments that we slow down and take time for the important things.
so happy to be loved by so many beautiful people- my heart would explode if I were not able to offer it back tenfold.
so excited-butterflies in my belly. I still have a hard time sleeping on xmas eve.
I miss my periphial vision- I can see so much less but my sense of hearing and smell seems sharper...the human body is so interesting.
